name: ABC
text: Michael Jordan says he is "deeply saddened, truly pained and plain angry" after the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/Wop1FACrkX https://t.co/wuXPWnf2KE

name: ABC
text: Powerful moment in Los Angeles as several LAPD officers step forward to take a knee during protest outside police headquarters. https://t.co/8Vcq0iVUnX https://t.co/0GCKmPYRIe

name: ABC
text: Police chief fired, two officers on administrative leave after a barbecue business owner in Kentucky was shot dead by law enforcement trying to enforce curfew. https://t.co/RVj9bvpeqw

name: ABC
text: WATCH LIVE: We have continuing coverage of protests from coast to coast following the death of George Floyd in Minnesota. https://t.co/goar4MWBPO

name: ABC
text: The U.S. Press Freedom Tracker, an advocacy and research group that records reported attacks on journalists, says it is investigating over 100 instances of attacks on members of the press from just the last three days. https://t.co/ESHd7Sh5qV

name: ABC
text: Hundreds of demonstrators staged a die-in in New York City's Times Square to call for justice after the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/4nYibwH8fI https://t.co/QszHEgghi7

name: ABC
text: MORE: The bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington said in a statement that she was “outraged” by Pres. Trump's visit to the historic St. John's Church across from the White House. https://t.co/0a7KNwtdmd https://t.co/cnsuTV34jO

name: ABC
text:
This Minnesota National Guard soldier knelt with protesters, telling them his "heart hurts as a human being" after the death of George Floyd.

The soldier announced the guard would remain inside the state Capitol until curfew. https://t.co/zWc385s6pV https://t.co/VhG7vcRpaT

name: ABC
text:
Protesters in Washington, D.C. tackle a man seen breaking up sidewalk curbs with a hammer, and hand him over to police.

Demonstrators said they tackled the man to prevent him provoking officers. https://t.co/OGuRCsZ0m3 https://t.co/NQwJmrEeeE

name: ABC
text: Single mom who moved her family from New Orleans to Houston after devastation of Hurricane Katrina celebrates her son's graduation by holding commencement ceremony in her backyard. https://t.co/t7kGHG99MZ

name: ABC
text: 57% of Americans say it’s more important to try to control the spread of COVID-19 than to try to restart the economy, new @ABC News/WaPo poll finds. https://t.co/0gFeVRrlRP

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Barack Obama has published an essay addressing the protests following the death of George Floyd and how to use this moment to make "real change." https://t.co/pdrFoIMOGw https://t.co/kWaDABfY3T

name: ABC
text: Police forcefully pushed back demonstrators outside the White House to clear a way for President Trump to visit a church, just minutes after he said he wanted a military show of force against violent protests gripping the country. https://t.co/j5u1gBEB6g https://t.co/UyS02REYGb
